channel.title: A (failed) Technilogical Advancement
channel.description:
Before my router broke last week, it was the fastest and best router I have ever had. When I ordered a new one, from the same company, they shipped one for 90$; The router was supposed to be 'faster' and 'better' than the previous one was.
After 6 calls to some Indians speaking for Tech Support, 5 1/2 hours of my time wasted, and countless hours of frustration: My Xbox 360 has a .2fps on live, I must repair my connection on my computer once every 5 minutes, my sister and brother cannot connect to the internet whatsoever, and somehow Windows Vista and Windows 7 can connect perfectly without any adjustments whatsoever.
In technological advancements, shouldn't they consider past technology? (I'm running XP and this router has failed to work correctly.)
The Tech Support said it could be a problem with our adapters (which I believe so), however, I find it extraordinarily ridiculous how the same company that created our wireless adapters cannot create a new router that can function without us having to buy new adapters as well.
I'm officially pissed.

item.title: A (failed) Technilogical Advancement
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I was wondering why you wasn’t on msn man. I hope you get it fixed soon ( hit me up a message when it does gotta catch after Blue Planet. <3)

Read full topic

item.title: A (failed) Technilogical Advancement
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

They’re sending us a replacement.

@Silab: I honestly couldn’t have researched it, as it is rather new, I know no one who has this router, and I did not have my internet to see any reviews.

Read full topic

item.title: A (failed) Technilogical Advancement
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

You’re mad because something you purchased does not work because you failed to research what you were buying prior to purchasing and if you had done your research chances are you would not be having this problem?

Read full topic

item.title: A (failed) Technilogical Advancement
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

cool story bro

Now seriously.

Give the router back. Ask for your money. Say “Fuckahz” and look for another internet provider… If they were you provider…
